title: Calories Burned in Sauna
meta_description: Learn calories burned in sauna per typical 30-minute session, factors influencing burn rate, and tips for accurate tracking.
assumptions: 30-minute session in traditional dry sauna at 160-200°F; average 155 lb (70 kg) adult at rest; no intense activity.
disclaimer: Calories burned vary by body weight, session length, sauna type, temperature, hydration, and individual metabolism. Consult a doctor for personalized advice.

quick_answer.text: A typical 30-minute sauna session burns about 70 calories, similar to light sitting.

label_note: Values represent energy expenditure; macronutrients are not applicable as this is not dietary intake.

faqs.q: How many calories burned in sauna per hour?
faqs.a: About 140 calories for an average adult in a 60-minute session.

faqs.q: Does sauna burn more calories than resting?
faqs.a: Yes, roughly 1.5 times your resting rate, but it's modest—around 70 kcal for 30 minutes.

faqs.q: What affects calories burned in sauna?
faqs.a: Body weight, session duration, sauna temperature, and humidity; heavier individuals burn more.

faqs.q: Is sauna good for weight loss?
faqs.a: It burns few calories and causes temporary water loss, not fat; combine with diet and exercise.

faqs.q: Calories burned in sauna vs. walking?
faqs.a: Sauna burns less—30 min walking burns 100-150 kcal, while sauna is about 70 kcal.
